project_1: Developed a desktop-based profile management system using Java and JavaFX enabling users to
create, edit, view, and persist personal profile records through a graphical user interface.
Implemented a modular, object-oriented architecture separating UI logic, data handling,
and persistence, with support for dynamic form updates, event-driven input handling,
and file-based storage. Designed reusable components for profile editing, profile listing,
and data validation, demonstrating practical application of OOP principles
(encapsulation, abstraction, modularity) and familiarity with MVC-inspired design patterns.
Key Technologies: Java, JavaFX, File I/O, Object-Oriented Programming, Event Handling

project_4: Designed and simulated a structured enterprise network using Cisco Packet Tracer, modelling a multi-department office environment.

The project involved planning and implementing a centralised network architecture connecting multiple functional areas including offices, meeting rooms, open-plan workspaces, reception, kitchen, and bathrooms.
Configured core networking devices such as switches, routers, servers, and end-user hosts, ensuring efficient connectivity across all departments.

Implemented logical network segmentation to reflect organisational layout, improve traffic management, and enhance scalability. Integrated a main server/network room to centralise services and manage internal communication.
Applied fundamental networking concepts including LAN design, device interconnection, IP addressing, and structured cabling principles.
The topology demonstrates an understanding of real-world enterprise network planning, device placement, and connectivity flow between access, distribution, and core components.
project_5: Developed a Book Validation System to manage and verify book records within a structured system environment.
The project focused on data validation, record management, and logical system design to ensure accuracy and consistency of book information such as IDs, titles, authors, and availability status.
Implemented input validation rules to prevent incorrect or duplicate entries and ensure data integrity.
Designed the system to support efficient searching, updating, and verification of records, simulating real-world use cases such as library or inventory management systems.

Emphasised clean system logic, modular design, and user-friendly interaction, demonstrating an understanding of how validation systems support reliability and operational efficiency in information management.
project_6: Designed and implemented an automated browser-based system to log into the NWU eFundi platform and download course resources.
Migrated a complex Selenium-based workflow to **Playwright**, improving reliability, speed, and download handling.
Implemented recursive traversal of course sites and nested resource folders.
Built structured local download directories reflecting online folder hierarchies.
Added **parallel download support** using asynchronous programming with controlled concurrency.
Integrated **retry mechanisms** for failed downloads to improve robustness.
Implemented **per-file progress tracking** using `tqdm` for real-time feedback.
Ensured secure credential handling via runtime input and environment variables.
Added persistent tracking of downloaded resources to prevent duplication.
